page.title: 13OLD RESIDENT INTERVIEW
page.content: Two children interviewed one of the oldest residents of Stroud.He attended Parliament Street School as a boy and has always lived in the area.When asked about his school days he said that there were 6 classes including the Infants and that the ages ranged from 4 to 13.He was 13 years old when he left school and took a job as a drivers mate on a petrol wagon,for which he was paid 15 shillings{(75p)}a week. He said that there were small private shops then,instead of supermarkets,and there weren't any one way streets or link roads.The main industries then were cloth mills, carpet factories,engineering and brewing.There are many more houses now compared with the past.
